channel.title: I'm ready to look like a noob
channel.description:
I have Windows 7 64 bit if that makes any difference.
When I go to compile my server it comes up blank(black screen with a blinking underscore) This is what I have the in the "Edit"
@ECHO OFF title Server "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause
When I go to run my server it says
Starting TestScape server on 0.0.0.0:43594
Need more information and screenshots? I would be happy to give you TONS of screenies and information just tell me what you need. Thanks.

item.title: I'm ready to look like a noob
item.dc:creator: @GnarlyUnicorn GnarlyUnicorn
item.description:
@GnarlyUnicorn wrote:

I’m assuming I’ll have to change my CLASSPATH and all that stuff again after downloading it?

Read full topic
item.source: I'm ready to look like a noob

item.title: I'm ready to look like a noob
item.dc:creator: @GnarlyUnicorn GnarlyUnicorn
item.description:
@GnarlyUnicorn wrote:

Do you think it would be okay to download 32 bit java onto my computer?

I was just reading the Java FAQ and they said the only reason why you would download 64 bit java is because my internet is 64 bit.

But if I downloaded 32 bit Java for RSPS do you think it would work?

Read full topic
item.source: I'm ready to look like a noob

item.title: I'm ready to look like a noob
item.dc:creator: @GnarlyUnicorn GnarlyUnicorn
item.description:
@GnarlyUnicorn wrote:

Jingojohn:

Re-install Windows 7 and choose 32-bit. Lol. Jk, not sure.

Haha. Its like problem after problem.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm ready to look like a noob
item.dc:creator: @GnarlyUnicorn GnarlyUnicorn
item.description:
@GnarlyUnicorn wrote:

Okay so now I open my client and I do 2 clicks and it closes by itself. This is because I have windows 7 64 bit.

I know theres a fix for this can someone help me?

Read full topic

item.title: I'm ready to look like a noob
item.dc:creator: @nikolaww3 nikolaww3
item.description:
@nikolaww3 wrote:

ur win 7 do this im win 7 too here is for compiler

@echo off
title Server Compiler
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

Read full topic

No problem, and welcome to RuneScape Private Servers

item.title: I'm ready to look like a noob
item.dc:creator: @GnarlyUnicorn GnarlyUnicorn
item.description:
@GnarlyUnicorn wrote:

Alright thanks for all the help I really appreciate it.

Sorry to make it difficult for you guys.

Trust me though I really appreciate it thanks a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm ready to look like a noob
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“GnarlyUnicorn, post:9, topic:355277”]Oh alright.

Heres the last question I hope. s p i d a z told me to log in or whatever. How do I log in if nothing comes up to even log into?[/quote]You need to download and start a client. I suggest you finish reading the tutorial on how to start a server.

Read full topic

Heres the last question I hope. s p i d a z told me to log in or whatever. How do I log in if nothing comes up to even log into?

item.title: I'm ready to look like a noob
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You don’t need to run as admin. You are getting the new error because it is trying to run the program from an administrators folder, so just run it using your own user. The first picture is how it should look when you do it properly.

Read full topic
item.source: I'm ready to look like a noob

item.dc:creator: @GnarlyUnicorn GnarlyUnicorn
item.description:

And when I run as admin on run server its says

item.description:

lol, that just means it is on… Log in it will say more stuff.

Use your brain a little bit more. Trail and error is the best way to learn.

Sorry for being such a noob.

item.title: I'm ready to look like a noob
item.dc:creator: @GnarlyUnicorn GnarlyUnicorn
item.description:
@GnarlyUnicorn wrote:

[quote=“Jingojohn, post:3, topic:355277”]You can put this:

@echo off
title Server Compiler
echo Compiling Server
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
echo Finished!
pause[/quote]

Okay I did that and heres what happened.

Read full topic
